Description: Papyrus written with black ink with demotic administrative text on recto (3 ll.), verso pasted down. Receipt for taxes paid by Teianti(?) daughter of Zeho in respect of land or houses purchased by her. Thompson's MS Catalogue: "year 5 Athyr 22 of Ptol. Philadelphus = BC. 280. Jan. 21 [...] Perhaps 10536 is the tax receipt in connection with the sale in P. dem. Rylands xii.xiii." Nos.10522-10532 and 10535-10537 belonging to the same archive, cf. P. BM EA 10522.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Thebes (historic - Upper Egypt) ((VS Thompson's MS, which gives Gebelein))
Bibliographic references: Pestman 1961 / Marriage and matrimonial property in ancient Egypt : a contribution to establishing the legal position of the woman (p.88) (cited in note 5 as comparison)
Glanville 1939 / Catalogue of Demotic Papyri in the British Museum I: A Theban Archive of the Reign of Ptolemy I, Soter (p.xlvi, 41-2, pl.12)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (43767) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/43767)
